alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines; St. Bernard; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines, St. Bernard and St. Charles. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Metairie, Timberlane, Avondale, Chalmette, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Terrytown, Elmwood, Arabi, River Ridge, Waggaman, Meraux and Violet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines; St. Bernard; St. Charles
